one thynge / & yet none knewe of an other / & all they went to vyſyte a holy fader ſaynt Anub / & were caryed all ouer that water by myracle / & eueryche of them had a ſinguler reuelacyon of ye ſame ſaynt Anub & he had reuelacyon of them & theyr thoughtes / & in ye mornyng after he dyed amonge them / & they after / all full of ſctīte & ꝑfeccyon. The feeſt alſo of many oth.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxvij. day of February. In alexander the paſſyon of ſaynt Iulian a martyr / yt was ſeke of ye gowte not able to go / & therfore he was brought before the iudge on horſbacke / with his ſeruaūt ſaynt Euno / by whome they were iudged to be caryed thrugh the cite vpon mules / & in the ſyght of ye people to be ſcourged in dyuerſe ſtretes / & theyr fleſſhe was rent & torne wt hokes / tyll by ſuche turmentes they were deed. In ſpayne in the cite of hyſpale the feeſt of ſaynt Leandre a byſſhop & cōfeſſour / by whoſe prechynge / wyſdome and doctryne / all the gotes wt theyr kynge ſaynt Recared were conuerted from ye wycked hereſye of Arrius At lyons ye feeſt of ſaynt Baldomere / at whoſe tombe ben done many grete myracles. In alexander the feeſt of ſaynt Abundance / and of ſaynt Fortunion.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At ceſary capadoce ye feeſt of ſaynt Honoryne a holy virgyn / yt after many ſtraūge turmentes was ſlayne by the ſwerde / & with her were put to deth ſaynt Kalixt & ſaynt Triſt bothe virgyns / yt by her were cōuerted vnto Chryſtes fayth. The feeſt of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxviij. daye of February. In the terrytory of lyons the feeſt of ſaynt Romane / fyrſt an heremyte / &
after an abbot / euer of holy cōuerſacyon & famous in myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Machare / ſaynt Rufyne / ſaynt Iuſt / & ſaynt Theophyle. In englonde at worceſter the feeſt of ſaynt Oſwalde an archebyſſhop of moche vertue.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ In yrelonde ye feeſt of ſaynt Ayd. At Rome the feeſt of ſaynt Iohn̄ a monke of hygh perfeccyon / yt was cloſed in a ſtrayte ſell / & foūde of almes by his owne fader & moder / but vnknowen vnto them / vnto the tyme of his deth. The feeſt alſo of an other ſaynt Iohn̄ an abbot in ſythe / that whan an heremyte came to vyſyte hym / that there had dwelled .xl. yeres / & ſaynt Iohn̄ axed hym of his mooſt ꝑfeccyon. He anſwered / ye ſonne (ſayd he) ſawe me neuer ete ne drynke. Ne me (ſayd ſaynt Iohn̄) angry / wrothe / or dyſpleaſed. Hereof is wrytē in vitas patrū. The feeſt alſo of ye thyrde ſaynt Iohn̄ an abbot alſo of ye deſert of ye hygher thebaydes that thre yeres contynually prayed euer ſtandynge / & neuer dyd he ſyt nor lye / ne neuer ete ne dranke / but yt euery ſondaye he receyued the body of our lorde / after he went forth to preche by the reuelacyon of an aūgell by whome he was euery ſonday refreſſhed at his ſell Of hym is alſo wryten in vitas patrū. The feeſt alſo of ye fourth ſaynt Iohn̄ / wryten of in vitas patrū alſo a gracyous man / & vnto all perſones moche cōfortable and of grete myracles. The tranſlacyon alſo of our holy fader ſaynt Auguſtyne / from hypponens vnto papye / ſolempnly done by kynge Luprand / kynge of longobardynes / in the yere of our lord .vij.c.xviij. & after his deth .CC. and .lxxx. yeres / at whiche tranſlacyon were done many grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / martyrs / confeſſours & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: Marche THe fyrſt day of Marche. at rome ye feeſt of .cclxij martyrs / whome ye emperour Claudius fyrſt condempned chryſtyans / & for theyr punyſſhement he ſet them to labour & to dygge ſondes for ye cite / & after ſyth they wolde not forſake Chryſt / they were teyed without ſalary gate in a playne / to be ſhotte at by the ſoudyours / & ſo put to deth. In cartage ye feeſt of ſaynt0 Donate a martyr / that by the iudge Vrſace / & the tribune Marcelline was there put to deth. In andegaue the feeſt of ſaynt Albyne a byſſhop & confeſſour / a famous man of ſynguler ſanctite. At maſſylye the feeſt of ſaynt Heremete and ſaynt Adrian. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Leo a martyr / of many myracles. In brytayne now wales / the feeſt of ſaynt Dauid an archebyſſhop and confeſſour / a man of many graces & notable vertues. In peruſe ye feeſt of ſaynt Erculaue a byſſhop.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In ſythe ye feeſt of ſaynt Sare an holy abbeſſe / yt in youth was moche tempted wt lechery / but ſo by contynuall prayer ſhe reſyſted / that ye deuyll appered vnto her & ſayd / yu haſt vaynquyſſhed & ouercome me. Nay ſayd ſhe / my lorde god & ſauyour Chryſt / & not I hath vaynquyſſhed & confounded the / & than ſhe went in to deſert / & there was an abbeſſe of bleſſed lyfe .lx. yeres. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Syncletyke an abbeſſe alſo in ye ſame wyldernes / of whome is wryten in vitas patrū The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The ſeconde day of Marche. at rome in latyn ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Iouyne & ſaynt Baſylewe martyrs that were put to deth by ye emperours Galiene & Valeriane.
At rome alſo ye feeſt of many martyrs vnnombred / that by ye emperour alexander were put to deth by many turmentes. In englond at lychefelde ye feeſt of ſaynt Chadde a byſſhop & confeſſour / whoſe lyfe of meruaylous vertue ſaȳt Bede wryteth. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Lucius a biſſhop / ſaynt Abſolon and ſaynt Lorge confeſſours.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Cedde yt was naturall broder vnto ſaynt Chadde a byſſhop alſo & a cōfeſſour of ſynguler vertue & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Symplice pope & martyr. In ytaly ye feeſt of .CCCC martyrs that were put to deth by ye longobardes. In affryke the feeſt of many byſſhops / prelates & clerkes that in the tyme of the emperour Iuſtinian were put to deth by the wandales. In englonde ye feeſt of ſaynt Wyllyam a preeſt of grete fame in vertue & myracles that flouryſſhed in the tyme of the emperour Henry ye thyrde. And the feeſt of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The thyrde day of Marche. at ceſary paleſtyne the feeſt of ſaynt Maryne / a man of warre / yt confeſſynge the name of Chryſt boldly / was heded in the perſecucyon of the emperour Valeriane / by whoſe conſtancy ſaynt Aſtece a ſenatour cōfeſſed hymſelfe a chryſtyan alſo / & lapped the holy corps in his ſenatours cloke / to haue buryed it wt due honour / for the whiche he was forthwt put to the ſame deth. In galace at legionens ye feeſt of ſaynt Enuthere & ſaynt Seledon yt were there ſoudyours / & put to many turmentes / & after brought to calagurryn / & there receyued the crowne & palme of martyrdome. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt wynewale a byſſhop.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ In almayne at bamberge the feeſt of ſaynt Kunegund a virgyn / & wyfe vnto ſaynt Henry ye emperour and yet bothe by one aſſent kepynge purite lyued virgyns / notwtſtandynge / ſhe by the malyce of ye deuyll & enuyous ſuſpicyon was accuſed of incontynency / but ſhe for her purgacyon went barefoted thrugh a grete fyre of grete length / & vpon coles & glowȳge hote yren wtout blemyſſhe or noyaunce / & ſo was declared. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .iiij. day of Marche. at rome in appia ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Luke pope & martyr / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of ye emperours Valeriane & Galiene was fyrſt put to exile for Chryſt / & after by dyuyne reuelacyon he was called home vnto his chirche / & there heded. At Rome alſo in ye ſame ſtrete ye feeſt of .ix.C. martyrs / that in ye ſame ꝑſecucyon were put to deth / & buryed in ye cimytery of ſaynt Cicilyes. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Gay and ſaynt Palatyne that were drowned in the ſee / & with them .xxvij. other perſones all martyrs.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At nicomede ye feeſt of ſaynt Adrian / that after many affliccyons was there put to deth / & wt hym .xxiij. other ꝑſones all martyrs. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Tabite / yt in ye grete monaſtery of thebaydes was holden & ſuppoſed a fole & drabbe of kechyn / of whome was reuelacyon made vnto ſaynt Piery / whiche knowen ſhe fledde in to deſert. The feeſt alſo of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .v. day of Marche. At antioche ye feeſt of ſaynt Foke a martyr / yt ſuffred many affliccyons & open batayle wt the deuyll in ye ſyght of ye people / wherof they
ſpeke vnto this daye. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Euſebius ſaynt Palatyne / & .xj. other martyrs. In yrelonde the feeſt of ſaynt Ciaue a byſſhop and confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Quiryake a byſſhop & martyr / that was ye ſame Iudas yt was cōpelled by ſaynt Elene to fynde the holy croſſe / & after his baptym he was biſſhop of Ieruſalem / & put to deth for ye fayth of the croſſe. At paleſtyne ye feeſt of ſaynt Theophile byſſhop of ye ſame cite / of whome ſaynt Ierome wryteth grete prayſe. And ye feeſt of an other ſaynt Theophyle byſſhop of alexander / a man of excellent doctryne / that confoūded many hereſyes / & wrote many werkes agaynſt them. In cornwell ye feeſt of ſaynt Pyrane / called alſo ſaynt Keran / borne of the nobles of yrelonde in the tyme of ſaynt Patryke / a man of hygh ꝑfeccyon & very many myracles / & had viſyon of aūgels / & lyued meruaylouſly longe without ſekenes or diſeaſe. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .vj. day of Marche. At nicomede ye feeſt of ſaȳt Victor & ſaynt Victoryne / yt by the ſpace of thre yeres were with ſaynt Claudiane & ſaynt Baſſe his wyfe / in grete affliccyon / & at the laſt they dyed in pryſon. At tolete ye depoſycyon of ſaynt Iulian a byſſhop / yt there is had in grete honour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At terdon the feeſt of ſaynt Marcian a byſſhop and martyr / yt by aūgels was brought out of pryſon for ye conforte of ſaynt Secūde / whiche ſaynt Secūde was ledde by an aūgell / after yt vnto hym in ye ſame priſon / & brought hym the ſacrament of Chryſtes body before his martyrdome. In englond the feeſt of ſaynt Kyneburge
/ doughter vnto kynge Penda / & wyfe vnto the kyng of the marches / & after an holy abbeſſe. And the feeſt alſo of her ſyſter ſaynt Kenyſwyde a virgyn / yt after her ſucceded abbeſſe. And ye feeſt alſo of theyr kynſwoman ſaynt Tybbe a virgyn / & all thre of ſynguler ſanctite & grete myracles. And ye feeſt of many oth.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .vij. day of Marche. At mauritane amonge ye tyburbitans ye feeſt of ye holy women ſaȳt Perpetua & ſaynt Felicite martyrs / & of ſaynt Reuocate and ſaynt Saturnyne / that wt them by the prynce Seuere were put to deth all deuoured wt wylde beeſtes / & the feeſt of ſaynt Secūdole that was taken with them / but he dyed in pryſon / and ſo with them a martyr.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Thomas of aquyne / a noble man borne / & yet more noble in vertue & myracles / & yt amonge holy ſayntes was of excellent lernynge / and amonge lerned men of ſynguler ſanctite. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Satyre / broder vnto ſaȳt Saturnyne / & (after ſome auctours) put to deth wt his broder & his felowes. In the monaſtery of ſaynt Paule vpon ye water of tyne in englonde / ye feeſt of ſaynt Eſterwyne abbot of the ſame / & a man of grete ꝑfeccyon. And ye feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .viij. day of Marche. At antion ye feeſt of ſaynt Philomon & ſaynt Apollyn a deacon / yt bycauſe they wolde not do ſacrefice vnto the ydolles / were thrylled or bored thrugh the heles vnder ye ancles / & ſo drawen by cordes thrugh ye cite / & at ye laſt ſlayne by ye ſwerde. In the ſame cite ye feeſt of ſaynt Ariane / ſaynt Theotyke
/ & of other thre ꝑſones all martyrs / yt after many horryble turmentes were drowned in ye ſee / whoſe holy bodyes were brought to londe by a delfyne. At cartage the feeſt of ſaynt Ponce a deacon / & of ſaynt Cirpriane a byſſhop & his companyon in all troubles / of whoſe lyfe / noble actes and paſſion he made a notable boke / & after for Chryſt ſuffred gloryous martyrdom. In brytayne ye feeſt of ſaȳt Felix a byſſhop & cōfeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ In yrelonde the feeſt of ſaynt Fenan a byſſhop / of whome ſaȳt Patryke ꝓphecyed .vj. ſcore yeres before he was borne / ſhewynge yt ſuche a man of his name & maner / ſhold be in his rome archebyſſhop of yrelonde / and ſo he was / & of lyke holynes and myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .ix. day of Marche. At nice ye feeſt of ſaȳt Gregory a byſſhop / & broder vnto ſaȳt Baſyle byſſhop of ceſariens / a man of grete fame / ſynguler doctryne / goodly eloquence / & of hygh ꝑfeccyon. At barcinon the feeſt of ſaynt Pacian / yt dyed in the tyme of prynce Theodos. At ſebaſten the feeſt of .xl. martyrs all famous men of warre.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In the regyon of galace the feeſt of ſaynt Phyllorrony a preeſt of meruaylous abſtinence / & of cōtynuall labours / & oftentymes had open batayle wt euyll ſpirytes / & yet was of grete cōtemplacion. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Gadane / a man of harde lyuyng / for he neuer lay in hous ne couerture / but alwaye in ye open ayre & weder. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .x. day of Marche. At apamia the feeſt of ſaynt
Alexander / & ſaynt Gay martyrs / that (as ſaynt Apolinar byſſhop of Ierapolitan wryteth in his boke agaynſt the catafryges) were put to deth in ye perſecucyon of Antonyn vere. In perſe ye feeſt of .xlij. martyrs At parys ye feeſt of ſaynt Dorothene an abbot / & diſcyple vnto ſaynt Germayn the byſſhop. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Atale an abbot & diſcyple vnto ſaynt Colūbane. And ye feeſt of ſaynt Agathe / ſaynt Gorgon and ſaynt Fyrme.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Syluia a virgyn / that was doughter vnto ye mayre of alexander / & of grete doctryne / & very eloquent / & ſpent ye nyghtes hooly in redȳge of holy ſcripture / & the daye in prayer & cōtemplacyon content wt lytell ſlepe & ſmall fedynge / & ſhe lyued in ye wyldernes of the thebaides .lx. yeres / & neuer laye in bedde ne ſtrawe / but vpon the bare erth. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xj. day of Marche. At ſebaſten in ye leſſe armenye the feeſt of .xl. martyrs men of warre / yt by kynge Lucyne had many turmentes / & at ye laſt theyr thyes & legges were broken / & ſo ended theyr martyrdome / ye capytaynes and mooſt noble men of them were ſaynt Cirion & ſaynt Candidus.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In the marches of englond the feeſt of ſaynt Paule byſſhop of leoneus / yt whan he was a nouyce droue before hym a flocke of byrdes that deſtroyed the corne / & brought them vnto his abbot to be punyſſhed. And after he cōmaunded the ſee to remoue a myle backe / & to leue all yt lande vnto the monaſtery / & ſo it yet remayneth / wt many other grete myracles. At cartage ye feeſt of ſaynt Hyrade / ſaynt zozime / ſaynt Alexander / ſaynt
Candidus / ſaynt Piperion / & other .xx. ꝑſones all martyrs. In fraunce the feeſt of ſaynt Gūpert byſſhop of herbipole / yt for his holynes & hygh vertue / was compelled agaynſt his wyll to be a byſſhop / & he lyued but a ſmal tyme after. The feeſt alſo of many other ho.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xij. day of Marche. At rome the feeſt of ſaynt Gregory the pope / & one of the .iiij. doctours / called alſo the apoſtle of englond / bycauſe he ſent ſaynt Auguſtyne in to englonde / by whome the people there were cōuerted. At nicomede ye paſſyon of ſaynt Peter a martyr / yt was ſeruaūt & of ye chambre wt the prynce Dioclecian / & whan he ſawe the cruelte of his prynce vnto the chryſtyans / he boldly reproued hym / for ye whiche he was hanged by the heles & ſcourged / & his fleſſhe rent & toren / & than vynegre & ſalte caſt therupon / & after he was broyled vpon the coles / & ſo made the hoſte & ſacrefyce of Chryſt. At the ſame cite the feeſt alſo of ſaynt Eddune a preeſt wt other .vij. martyrs / yt vnto ye terrour & fere of the people were put to deth eche after other. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Alphege byſſhop of wentane & a confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At rome the feeſt of ſaynt Peter a deacon / & diſciple vnto ſaynt Gregory. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Syſyn a monke of grete vertue / but ſynguler in chaſtite / ſo yt he neuer knewe differēce bytwene man kynde & women. In the deſert of thebaydes ye feeſt of ſaynt Diocles / yt was fyrſt a ſeculer philoſopher of grete lernyng / & after of ſtrayte & harde lyuyng cloſed in a caue many yeres vnto ye ende of his lyf. And ye feeſt of many oth.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xiij. daye of Marche. At nicomede the feeſt of
ſaynt Macedon a preeſt / ſaynt Patryke / & ſaynt Modeſt martyrs. At nice the feeſt of ſaynt Thenſete / ſaȳt Horre / ſaynt Theodour / ſaȳt Nympodour / ſaȳt Marke / & ſaynt Arabye martyrs / all brent. At thebaydes ye feeſt of ſaynt Eufraſe a virgyn.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Capithon a cōfeſſour / that in youth was a ſtronge thefe / & after went in to wyldernes / & there for his penaunce he encloſed hymſelfe in a denne .l. yeres / & neuer came in to ye company of people The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Amata a virgyn & an abbeſſe of lx. virgyns in ye deſert of thebaides / a woman of hygh ꝑfeccion / & in ye age of .lxxx. yeres ſhe before her ſyſters not feynynge ſeke ne dyſeaſed / made her redy to be buryed / & whan ſhe came vnto ye ſepulcre / ſhe yelded her ſpiryte. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xiiij. day of Marche. At rome the feeſt of .xlix. martyrs / that were baptyzed of ſaynt Peter / whyle he was in pryſon in the kepynge Mamurtyne wt his coapoſtle and felowe ſaynt Paule / where they were kepte .ix. monethes / but theſe holy ſayntes were put to deth by the tyranny & ſwerde of the cruel emperour Nero. In affryke the feeſt of ſaynt Peter a martyr. And the feeſt of ſaynt Eufroſe a byſſhop & confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In egypte ye feeſt of ſaynt Punyfyke / an honourable preeſt & abbot of many monkes / & of hygh ꝑfeccion & many myracles / yt in his age wyllynge to auoyde ye fame & prayſe of the worlde / fledde pryuely in a ſeculer habyte vnto an other abbey in deſert / of more ſtrayter lyuynge / & there he remayned many dayes / layenge ſtyll before ye gates / deſyryng to be receyued / but they
longe deferred bycauſe of his age / yet at ye laſt by his importunite / they toke hym / & there he dyd the mooſt vyle labours in ye hous / & oft he wold ryſe in ye nyght to do certayn labours neceſſary / bycauſe no man ſhold knowe the doer. Than his owne monaſtery fell in dekey / & the breder went abrode to ſeke hym / & whan he at ye laſt was founde / he returned home / & there ended his lyf. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xv. day of Marche. in ceſary Capadoce ye paſſyon of ſaynt Longyne / that perced & opened the ſyde of our ſauyour wt a ſpere / as in his legende is wryten The tranſlacyon alſo of ſaynt Leodegare a byſſhop & martyr. At ye cite of theſſolonyke the feeſt of ſaynt Macrone a martyr / a woman of grete cōſcyence / that confeſſyng euer the name of Chryſt / was beten to deth wt ſtaues. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Iames & ſaynt Luke / bothe byſſhops.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ In ſythe the feeſt of ſaynt Theremon an abbot / of hygh ꝑfeccyon. At pamphilye ye feeſt of ſaynt Arteby a byſſhop / that was an heremyte / & by violence was made byſſhop of ye ſayd cite / & well & holyly ruled his flocke / & there lyeth buryed. In ytaly ye feeſt of ſaynt Habetdeū / byſſhop of lunens & a martyr / yt after exyle & many troubles was heded by ye wādales. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xvj. day of Marche. at aquiley ye feeſt of ſaynt Hyllary a byſſhop / & ſaynt Taciane a deacon / yt were hanged on a gybet / & by many other turmētes put to deth / & wt them were alſo martyred ſaynt Felix / ſaynt Large / & ſaynt Denyſe. At rome the paſſyon of ſaynt
Ciriake a deacon / that after longe impryſonmēt was taken out & hote pytche wt ſulphure pored vpon hym / than was he racked & his mēbres ſtretched wt cordes / & at the laſt by the cōmaūdement of the tyraūt Maximian he was heded / & wt hym were put to deth ſaynt Large & ſaynt Smaragdus / with .xx. other ꝑſones / whoſe ſeconde feeſt is kepte the .viij. daye of Auguſt. whan they were tranſlated and tombed or ſhryned by ſaynt Marcel pope. At auerne ye feeſt of ſaynt Patrike a byſſhop & confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In yrelonde ye feeſt of ſaynt Fynan a byſſhop of ſynguler ſanctite / he reyſed thre ꝑſones from deth / wt many famous myracles. In ſcotlond ye feeſt of ſaynt Abbane / called alſo ſaynt Kyryne / whoſe ſyrname was Boniface / and therfore of many called ſaynt Boniface / borne in ye coūtree of galilee at bethſayda / & by nacyon a iewe / & ordered a byſſhop by ſaynt Iohn̄ patriarke of Ieruſalē / & after he was a grete pylgrym vnto all the places where Chryſt had ben / & than to Rome by reuelacyon / & from thens to ſcotlond / where he cōuerted the kynge & the coūtree / & after he went in to ye out yles / where he buylded .C. chirches / & cōuerted of the people vnto Chryſt .xxxvj.M. & reyſed .vij. ꝑſones frō deth / & he made ye defe to here / the blynde to ſe / ye lame to go / and he caſt out wycked ſpirytes / wt many other myracles / & he lyued vnto the age of .C. yeres & moo. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xvij. daye of Marche. In ſcotlonde the feeſt of ſaynt Patrike byſſhop & confeſſour / that fyrſt preched there Chriſtes fayth. At nicomede ye feeſt of ſaynt Eugene / ſaynt Pāphilian / ſaynt Caſtor / & ſaynt Serene.
The feeſt alſo of ſaynt witburge a virgyn. In the monaſtery of nūgell the feeſt of ſaynt Geretrude a virgyn and martyr.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At alexander the feeſt of ſaynt Ambroſe a deacon of the ſame cite & chefe chirche / & a notable man of hygh vertue. The feeſt of ſaynt Caſſiadour / yt was chaūceler vnto the kynge of ytaly / & after a ſenatour of rome & all he forſoke & was a monke of grete holynes & excellent lernyng / & wrote many werkes vnto the edifycacyon of Chriſtes chirche / & after his deth he dyd many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayn.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xviij. daye of Marche. In englond the feeſt of ſaynt Edward kynge & martyr / ſone & heyre vnto the noble kynge Edgare / that was a grete founder of monaſteryes / whiche ſayd kynge Edward as a true profeſſour of Chryſtes fayth / was martyred by the ꝑſecucyon of his ſtepdame / & of certayne lordes of her counſeyle / wherby he was ioyned vnto ye college & company of holy ſayntes in heuen / as playnly is declared by many grete miracles dayly ſhewed at his tombe. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Alexander a byſſhop / yt for deuocyon wente from capadoce his owne cite vnto Ieruſalem / where by diuyne reuelacyon he toke vpon hym ye cure & gouernaūce of ye cite / & after in his olde age he was brought pryſoner vnto ceſary / where for the fayth of Chryſt he was put to deth by the perſecucyon of the emperour Decius.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Frygdiane byſſhop of lucane & a cōfeſſour / of hygh ꝑfeccyon. And one of ye feeſtes of ſaynt Ancelme. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Geremare an abbot / borne of grete kynne / & after the deth of his parentes
he ſolde all his londes & goodes & dyſtrybuted vnto the poore / & after was made abbot by ſaynt Audowene / & yet remoued thens by the enuy of his monkes / but he after buylded an other monaſtery by the ſhewyng of an aūgell / & therin ſerued god vnto ye ende of his lyfe. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayn.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xix. day of Marche. the feeſt of ſaynt Iohn̄ / a man of grete ꝑfeccion / yt borne in ſyria came in to ytaly & there in the towne of penarens buylded a monaſtery & therin remayned all his lyfe / wt other religyous breder / & dyd many miracles. At ſuretyke ye feeſt of ſaynt Quynt / ſaynt Quyntyll / ſaynt Quartyll / ſaynt Marcyll / wt other .ix. all martyrs. At bryxe the feeſt of ſaynt Colotery a martyr. And the feeſt of ſaynt Ioſeph the holy virgyn & ſpouſe of our bleſſed lady & euer virgyn Mary / that alſo was nouryſſher & brynger vp of our ſauyour Chryſt. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Theodour a byſſhop / ſaynt Appolon / ſaynt Leonce / and ſaynt Florence. The trāſlacyon alſo of ſaȳt Mary mawdeleyn.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Remachlewe a byſſhop / that of humylite reſygned his byſſhopryke & was a poore monke & a nouyce & mooſt lowly in obedience / & lyued euer as a diſcyple / notwtſtandynge yt before he was a byſſhop. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſaynt.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xx. day of Marche. In englonde ye feeſt of ſaȳt Cutbert / that of an ancre was made biſſhop of lyndiſfarnēs / a man of grete age & ſynguler ſanctite / wt many grete myracles / whiche thynge his holy body doth teſtyfye / that yet remayneth vncorrupted. In aſya ye
feeſt of ſaynt Archyppe / that was diſciple vnto ſaynt Paule / & his contynual companyon in prechynge & in Chryſtes warre / of whome he wryteth vnto the coloſenſes. In ſyre the feeſt of ſaynt Paule / ſaynt Cyryll / ſaynt Eugene / & other .iiij. ꝑſones all martyrs. In the fraūchyſe of rone ye feeſt of ſaynt Vlfran a confeſſour & byſſhop.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At the monaſtery of criſpinens ye feeſt of ſaynt Landelme a cōfeſſour / yt fyrſt was in youth a ſtronge thefe & a robber / & after cōuerted by ſaynt Auſbert byſſhop of cameracēs / & after that he was diſcyple vnto ſaynt Martyne / & he foūded two monaſteryes / & was abbot in the ſayd criſpinens / of holy lyfe & many myracles / in whoſe tyme many famous ꝑſones came to religion out of englonde / ſcotlond / and other partyes / amonge whome was ſaȳt Gyſlen an abbot / ſaynt Maldegare a duke & ſaynt Valdetrude his wyf / & her ſiſter ſaynt Aldegūde / & ſaȳt Trude / wt many other / whoſe feeſtes be vnknowen. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxj. day of Marche. At ye caſtell of caſſyne the feeſt of the holy fader ſaynt Benedict / called ſaynt Benet an abbot / & fyrſt foūder of ye blacke monkes / whoſe holy lyfe full of vertue and myracles / ſaynt Gregory wryteth. In alexander the feeſt of ſaynt Serapion an ancre / & a man of ſynguler vertue. In the terrytory of lyons ye feeſt of ſaynt Lupycyne an abbot / whoſe gracyous & holy lyfe was by many myracles moche famous.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At rome the feeſt of ſaynt Benet ye pope / that from youth was of ſynguler vertue / & ſo encreaced & grewe therin that he was worthy yt dignite / he was of profoūde
mekenes / very pyteous & lyberall. The feeſt alſo of the thyrde ſaynt Benet a monke of campane .xl. myles from rome / that was ſore vexed by infydeles yt ſet fyre vpon his ſell / but it wolde not bren / than they hete an ouen fyre hote / & put hȳ cloſed therin all nyght & on ye morowe they foūde hym in helth / & his clothes vntouched / of hym wryteth ſaynt Gregory.iij. di. ca. xviij. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxij. daye of Marche. At ſeptimane in byterne the feeſt of ſaynt Affrodoſe a byſſhop & cōfeſſour / & the feeſt of ſaynt Paule / yt was ordered & made byſſhop of narbonens by ye apoſtle Paule / where after many gloryous actes & grete myracles / he reſted in our lorde.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Berno abbot of cluniacens / & the fyrſt foūder of yt religyon / a holy man of hygh perfeccyon / & many myracles / yt before his deth reſygned his rome vnto his owne diſcyple & monke ſaynt Odo / and ſo dyed an obedyenſer in the peace of Chryſt. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxiij. daye of Marche. In affryke the feeſt of ſaynt Victoriane / & of two natural breder called bothe by one name / ſaynt Frumence / that (as ſaynt Victor byſſhop of affricane wryteth) were put to many grete turmentes by ye kynge Honoryke for Chryſtes fayth. In antioche ye feeſt of ſaynt Theodour a preeſt. In ceſare the feeſt of ſaynt Iulian.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In affryke the feeſt of .xij. infantes yonge perſones that in the perſecucyon of the wandales / bycauſe they wolde not by ony ꝑſuaſyon or entreates forſake chryſt
they were ſcourged to deth / by the example of whome two ryche marchaūtes called bothe ſaynt Frumence by one name / and .v. religyous ꝑſones / ſaynt Liberate abbot of cartage / ſaynt Boniface a deacon / ſaynt Ruſtyke a ſubdeacon / & ſaynt Rogate & ſaynt Maximus monkes / were all put to deth for ye cōfeſſyon of Chryſt. In affryke alſo the feeſt of an other ſaynt Liberate wt his wyfe & two chylder / & ſaynt Creſcence a preeſt / wt an other chylde of .vij. yeres olde / yt in the perſecucyon of the arryanes were all put to deth for Chryſt. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxiiij. day of Marche. The grete hygh and ſolempne feeſt called ye ſouper of our lorde & ſauyour Ieſu / wherin he conſecrate ye ſacrament of his owne precyous body & blode / & therwt cōmuned his apoſtles / & waſſhed theyr fete. At Rome ye paſſion of ſaȳt Pigmeny a byſſhop / yt was mayſter & brynger vp of Iulian the apoſtata / that after forſoke & renyed Chryſt & his fayth / & was a cruell tyraūt & perſecutour therof / & ſo in the cite of tyberym he put to deth his owne mayſter the foreſayd ſaynt Pigmeny. In mauritane the feeſt of ſaynt Romule / ſaynt Secundole / naturall breder & martyrs. At ſyre ye feeſt of ſaynt Agapite a cōfeſſour of holy lyfe.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In affryke the feeſt of ſaynt Murite a martyr / yt by a renegate whome he before had baptized was put to deth / wt many other bothe of ye clergy & comyn people. In englond at the monaſtery of barkynge the feeſt of ſaynt Hyldelyth a virgyn / & nexte abbeſſe after ſaynt Ethelburge / a woman of ſynguler graces (as ſaynt Bede wryteth) and of many myracles / & put to deth &
brent with all her ſyſters / & the hole monaſtery by the danes yt ſlewe ſaynt Edmonde. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Sebba a kynge of englond / yt gyuen or applyed all to vertue of youth / wolde haue reſygned & left his crowne for to haue ben a religyous man / but the quene his wyfe wolde not conſent therunto / tyll after whan he had chylder / & had reygned .xxx. yeres / than ſhe aſſented / & he was a monke conſecrate by ye byſſhop of london / & was of ſynguler perfeccyon & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Mackartyne / yt came wt ſaynt Patryke from ytaly vnto yrelonde / & was cōtynually accōpanyed wt hȳ / & euery where famous of holy lyf & grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxv. daye of Marche. ye hygh & ſolempne feeſt called good fryday / in ye whiche daye our ſauyour Ieſu the lambe of god was offred in ſacrefyce for ye ſaluacyon of the worlde / & ſo enhaūced & exalted on ye croſſe / he by mooſt paynfull & mooſt ſhameful deth temporal redemed vs from deth eternall & euerlaſtynge. In nazareth at galilee the annunciacyon of our bleſſed lady ſaynt Mary / where (after ye byleue of our mooſt true fayth) the aūgell Gabriell ſaluted & grette her / yt was predeſtynate & ordeyned to chylde & brynge forth ye redemer of the worlde our ſwete ſauyour Chryſt Ieſu / ſhe notwtſtandynge euer remaynynge a virgyn mooſt pure / mooſt clene / immaculate & vndefouled. At ſiryne the paſſyon of ſaynt Hyren a byſſhop / that in the tyme of the emperour Maximus / after longe priſon & many cruell turmentes was heded. At rome ye feeſt of ſaynt Ciryne a martyr / yt by the kyng Claudius was ſpoyled of all his goodes / & than after hard pryſon & many
affliccyons & turmentes ſlayne by the ſwerde. At nicomede the feeſt of ſaynt Theole / called alſo ſaynt Dule a virgyn / yt was bond mayde vnto a man of warre / & ſlayne for ye defence of her chaſtite. In the yle of andro the feeſt of ſaynt Hermeland an abbot / whoſe holy lyf and conuerſacyon is euydent by many myracles.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ All though ſaynt Gabryell the archaūgell hath ne ꝓpre ne ſpecyall daye feſtyuall / yet is he of many perſones more deuoutly and ſingulerly honoured as this daye / bycauſe that on ye ſame daye he brought ye mooſt ioyfull meſſage of our ſaluacyon. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Dyſmas the thefe that was hanged vpon the ryght hande of Chryſt / & he is a cōfeſſour & not a martyr / bycauſe he was put to deth by deſeruynge for his owne ſynnes & euyll dedes / & not for ye fayth of Chryſt. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxvj. daye of Marche. the holy & ſolempne ſaterdaye / in the whiche our lorde & ſauyour Ieſu after his deth / repauſed and reſted in his ſepulcre / therby ſhewynge & aſſurynge vs / yt yf we dye well / we ſhall haue reſt euerlaſtȳge in our ſoules. At pentapolym in libia the feeſt of ſaynt Theodour a byſſhop / ſaynt Hyreney a deacon / ſaynt Serapion and ſaynt Ammony bothe lectours in order.Note. In the holy ſacrament of preſthode bē vii. orders.
i. Lector.
ii. Hoſtiarie.
iii. Exorciſt.
iiii. Colet.
v. ſubdeacon.
vi. Deacon.
vii. Preeſt.
At rome in lauicane ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Caſtole a martyr / yt (as is wryten in the werkes of ſaȳt Sebaſtyan) was thre tymes hanged & euer taken downe & newly examyned / & whan by no meanes he wolde forſake Chryſt / but rather wt more conſtancy cōfeſſed his name / he was buryed quycke & moche ſonde & grauell caſt vpon hym. At ſmyrme the
feeſt of ſaynt Montane a preeſt / & ſaynt Maximian / yt bothe togyder were drowned in the ſee / & ſo martyrs.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In yrelond ye feeſt of ſaynt Fynchell an abbot / borne thereof blode royall / & euer frō youth gyuen to vertue and ſo contynued in many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Peter a byſſhop & confeſſour. At Rome ye feeſt of ſaynt Quiryne a martyr. yt after ſome auctours hath his ſolempnite & chefe feeſt the .xix. day of Ianuary wt ſaynt Martꝰ & his felowes. The feeſt alſo of many.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxvij. daye of Marche. the gloryous reſurreccyon of our lord & ſauyour Ieſu Chryſt / and the noble victory of his triumphe / wherby he ouercame ye deuyl & brake vp the gates & clauſures of hell / & therby alſo ſhewed playnly vnto vs example of our reſurreccyon bothe in ſoule & body / how yt in tyme to come we ſhall alſo aryſe / & as his propre membres folowe hym our heed vnto Ioye & blyſſe euerlaſtyng. In egypt ye feeſt of ſaynt Iohn̄ an holy heremyte / Nota. yt amonge other many myracles & tokens of vertue / ſhewed by ye ſpiryte of ꝓphecy vnto ye mooſt chryſten emperour Theodoſius how he ſholde haue the victory of ye tyraūt his enemy. In the fraūcheſt of aſpane the feeſt of ſaynt Euthery that was byſſhop of Tourney. At Pamon the feeſt of ſaynt Alexander a martyr of grete conſtancy.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Ioſeph ab arymathy / that buried ye body of our ſauyour / & therfore was by ye iewes put in pryſon / to the entent that after ye feeſt o • pace he ſholde be put to deth / vnto whome Chryſt apperynge conuayed & brought hym vnto his owne hous at arymathy
/ & after that he was baptized by the apoſtles / & preched wt them / & in prechynge he was taken & cloſed vp in a wall / where whan ye emperours deſtroyed Ieruſalē / he was foūde in good helth & went forth to preche agayne / & therin dyed wtout other martyrdom. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Nicodeme that halpe Ioſeph to bury Chryſt / & therfore the iewes dyd bete and ſtryke hym wt ſtaues / & lefte hym for deed / but ſaynt Gamaliell brought hym to his hous & kepte hȳ many dayes & at the laſt he buryed hym in his owne tombe / where after he hymſelfe & ſaynt Steuen were buryed. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Mary Iacobi / moder vnto ſaynt Iames the leſſe / & ſyſter vnto our bleſſed lady / that wt her was at ye deth of our ſauyour / & wt Mary mawdeleyn went to anoynt hym in the ſepulcre. The feeſt alſo of her ſyſter ſaynt Mary Salome / moder vnto ſaynt Iames ye more & vnto ſaynt Iohn̄ the euangelyſt / that wt the other two Maryes was alſo diligēt to anoynt our lord. And whan ſhe herde yt her ſone ſaynt Iohn̄ was taken at rome / ſhe came thyder / but than was he exiled / & ſhe returned vnto the cite of campane / where ſhe dyed / & laye in a denne or caue many yeres / tyll by the reuelacyons of ſaynt Iames her ſone / her holy body was foūde ſmellynge all ſwete as roſes / & there is honourably ſhryned / where almyghty god ſhewed many grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Rupert byſſhop fyrſt of warmaciens / & after of ſaltzpurge / a man of the blode royall of fraūce / & of hygh ꝑfeccyon & many grete myracles. And ye feeſt of ſaynt Virgyl yt after hȳ was byſſhop there / & a ſure folower of his ſteppes & ſanctite. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayn.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxviij. day of Marche. At ceſare paleſtyne the feeſt of ſaynt Pryſke / ſaynt Malcus & ſaȳt Alexander martyrs / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of ye emperour Valeriane were ſo hote kendled wt the feruour of Chryſtes fayth that wylfully they reproued the iudge of his cruell tyranny agaynſt the ſeruaūtes of Chryſt / for ye whiche the ſame iudge cauſed them to be deuoured wt wylde beeſtes. At cabilonens ye feeſt of ſaynt Gūdran a kyng that ſo feruently applied hymſelfe vnto the werkes of mercy & vnto ſpirytuall exercyſe / that he left & forſoke all tēporall eſtate / & gaue all his treſour & goodes vnto the chirche & vnto ye poore people / & was of hygh perfeccyon. At tharſe ye feeſt of ſaynt Caſtor / & ſaynt Dorothey.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Iohn̄ / whoſe ſyrname was called obedience / for his ſynguler ꝑfeccyon in ye vertue with other / & a man alſo of many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Syxt a pope / & of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxix. day of Marche. In affryke ye feeſt of ſaȳt Armogaſte / ſaynt Archymyne / & ſaynt Satyre cōfeſſours / yt in ye ꝑſecucyon of ye wandales vnder kyng Geſeryke / ſuſteyned & ſuffred many grete troubles for ye cōfeſſyon of Chryſt / & therin ended theyr lyues by martyrdome. At nicodeme the feeſt of ſaynt Paſtor / and of ſaynt Victoryn. And the depoſycyon of ſaynt Euſtace abbot of luxaniens / and fader of .vj.C. monkes / and a man of ſynguler vertue / and many myracles.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Or an heremyte of ſynguler ſanctite / yt by the ſpace of thre yeres was fedde wtout ony bodyly fode. In englond ye feeſt of ſaynt Gūdlewſe
a kynge of the ſouth parte of englond / & a kynges ſone euer moche deſyrous of ſpirytuall exercyſe & encreace of ꝑfeccyon / ſo yt an aūgell appered vnto hym & ſhewed hym a place on a hyll after his mynde & deſyre / where he ſholde do ſeruyce vnto almyghty god / wherfore he forthwt reſygned his crowne & realme vnto his ſone / & on yt hyll buylded a chirche / & therin lyued a ꝑfyte lyfe full of myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxx. day of Marche. At rome in appia ſtrete ye paſſyon of ſaynt Quiryne / & of ſaynt Trybune martyrs / yt vnder ye emperour Valerian were put to many turmētes / theyr tongues kytte / hāged vpon gybettes theyr handes & fete ſtryken of / & at the laſt ended theyr gloryous martyrdom by the ſwerde. In theſſalonyke the feeſt of ſaynt Dōnyne / ſaynt Philopole / and ſaynt Achayce. At the caſtell of ſyluanectence ye feeſt of ſaynt Rewle a biſſhop & cōfeſſour. At orliaūce ye feeſt of ſaynt Paſtor byſſhop of palatyne.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Secunde / a man of warre / yt was cōuerted vnto Chryſtes fayth by an aūgell / & after his baptym he was cōmuned by ye aūgel / & than after many meruaylous turmentes he was put to deth but his holy body was buryed by aūgelles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Mamertyn an abbot / yt was a pagan / & cōuerted by reuelacyon & myracle / & baptized of ſaynt German / & after hym abbot of ſynguler ꝑfeccion & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſa.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxxj. daye of Marche. the feeſt of ſaynt Amos the ꝓphete / that by the cruell kynge Ozie was bored thrugh the temples of the heed / & ſo put to deth / notwt ſtandyng
he was not fully deed / vnto ye tyme he came vnto his coūtree where he was buryed. At Rome the feeſt of ſaynt Balbyne a virgyn / & doughter vnto ſaȳt Quiryne the martyr / yt after ye courſe of this lyf ſpent in grete holynes / was buryed in appia ſtrete beſyde her ſayd fader. In affryke the feeſt of ſaynt Diodole & ſaynt Aneſye martyrs. At the monaſtery of fontanellence the feeſt of ſaynt wandrigeſyle & ſaynt Auſbert / whan theyr holy bodyes were tranſlated vnto ye chirche of ſaynt Peter ye apoſtle / wt grete ſolempnite & moche Ioyfull honour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Hugh byſſhop of granopole / of whome his moder whā he was in her wombe / had a reuelacyon / & he was after of grete holynes & many myracles. And after ſome auctours he was a monke of the charterhous / & one of the fyrſt foūders & begynners of yt ordre. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Amos an abbot in ye deſert of ſythe / & fader of .M. & .v.C. monkes / the mooſt holy & ꝑfyte cōgregacion yt we rede of. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Amony an abbot of ye inward & depe deſert of nitrea / & the feeſt of his two naturall breder / ſaynt Euſeby & ſaynt Eutymy / yt with hym were monkes / & ſo alſo his ſpūall breder / & of the thyrde broder a byſſhop vnnamed. And of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
Apryll. ¶ THe fyrſt daye of Apryll. At rome the paſſyon of ſaynt Theodour / ſyſter vnto the noble martyr ſaynt Heremete / a holy woman / & put to dethe by the prynce Aurelian / & buryed in ſalary ſtrete beſyde her ſayd broder. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Venance a byſſhop & martyr. In egypt the feeſt of ſaynt Victor & of ſaynt
Steuen / & the depoſicyon of ſaynt Valery an abbot.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Hugh a mōke / whome ſaynt Bernard made abbot of boneuale / a man of hygh vertue & grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Deodorike a byſſhop / that was coſyn vnto ye emperour Othon / a man of ſynguler deuocyon vnto relykes / ſo yt he gadered in to his chirche the relykes of .xx. ſayntes / where he after was buryed / & ſheweth many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The ſeconde daye of Apryll. At ceſare capadoce the paſſyon of ſaynt Theodoſe a virgyn & martyr / yt in the laſt dayes of the emperour Dioclecian offred her ſelfe wylfully amonge other chriſtyans yt were taken / and was put to many turmentes / racked / drowned in the water / & caſt vnto wylde wode beeſtes / wt other paynes / & yet after all ouercome & vaynquyſſhed / ſhe was heded. At lyons ye feeſt of ſaynt Niceſy ye biſſhop there whoſe lyfe and alſo deth was by holynes & myracles moche laudable & gloryous. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Euſtace abbot of luxoniens. At paleſtyne the feeſt of ſaynt Mary egypcyake / ſo called bycauſe ſhe was borne in egypt / yt from thens came vnto the cite of alexander / & there from the age of .xij. yeres vnto .xxix. ſhe lyued all in fylthy lechery a comyn woman / than came ſhe vnto Ieruſalem to ſe the holy croſſe / but Chryſt wolde not ſuffre her to come in to the temple / than ſhe loked by & ſawe an ymage of our bleſſed lady / before whiche ſhe kneled / & wt depe cōtrycyon & plenteous teres wepyng beſought her of helpe & ſocour / & than ſhe entred in to the temple & honoured ye holy croſſe wt grete reuerēce &
depe deuocyon / mekely beſechynge forgyuenes & mercy / & forthwt as ſhe went out / a voyce frō heuen ſpake vnto her / ſayenge. Mary / go in to ye wyldernes ouer & beyonde the water of Iordane / & there yu ſhalt obteyne ſaluacion. wherunto ſhe obeyed & there lyued .xvij. yeres wt two loues and a halfe of brede / & after ſhe lyued xxx. yeres by herbes & rotes / where than ſaynt zoſymas foūde her / of whome ſhe was purely & hooly confeſſed / & vpon ſherthurſdaye next ſhe went drye foted ouer ye water of Iordane vnto his monaſtery / & there of hym receyued the ſacrament of Chryſtes body / & ſo returned in to the ſame wyldernes / & there forthwt yelded her ſpiryte vnto almyghty god / whoſe holy body the ſame holy fader foūde a yere after hole & vncorrupted / vnto whome came a lyon & made ye graue / wherin he buryed her.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Dydake byſſhop of oxforde / that was mayſter vnto ſaȳt Dominyke / & a grete precher / & cōuerted many heretykes in the coūtree of albigens / & after came home & there lyeth ful of myracles The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The thyrde day of Apryl. In ſyth at thomis ye feeſt of ſaynt Euagrye a byſſhop / & of ſaynt Benygne. At theſſalonyke ye paſſyon of ſaynt Agapis a virgyn / & of ſaynt Chionye a virgyn alſo / yt bothe togyder ſuffred many affliccyons by the emperour Dioclecian / & after all they were caſt in to a grete fyre / but no thynge greued wtall / tyll they prayed our lorde to take them by yt martyrdom / & ſo he dyd. At tawromeny in cicile ye feeſt of ſaynt Pācrace. In englond ye feeſt of ſaynt Richard byſſhop of checheſter.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of an other ſaynt Euagrye a preeſt of grete doctryne / & made many werkes / & was of holy lyfe & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Florence byſſhop of argentyne / a man of gloryous lyfe & hygh ꝑfeccyon. And ye feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayn̄.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .iiij. day of Apryll. At mylen the depoſicyon of ſaynt Ambroſe byſſhop & cōfeſſour / by whoſe dilygēce & labouryous prechyng (beſyde his other noble actes of hygh doctryne / holy lyf & many myracles) all ytaly was cōuerted from the falſe opinyons & wycked hereſyes of ye curſed arryens. At hyſpale the depoſicyon of ſaynt Iſydour a byſſhop.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In englonde the feeſt of ſaynt Tiernake yt was of the kynges blode of yrelond / & in ye tyme of warre was taken a childe & brought in to englond & ſold as a bond man / whome for his fauour & beauty ye kyng bought & layde hym in his owne chambre / & euery nyght the bedde where he lay ſemed to be all on fyre / whiche perceyuynge the quene / cauſed hym to lye in bedde wt her two ſones / & on ye morowe after they were foūde bothe deed / but by his prayers they were reyſed / & than the kyng made hym free / & foūde hym to ſcole tyll he was a byſſhop / than after ye kynges deth he went to rome / in whiche iourney (beſyde other myracles) he reyſed ix. ꝑſones to lyfe / & whan he came home in to englond he reyſed ye yonge kynges wyfe & ſacred her a holy virgyn / & an other man that longe had ben deed / wt many other grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .v. day of Apryll. In egypt ye feeſt of ſaynt Nichandre / & of ſaynt Appolon martyrs. At theſſalonyke
the feeſt of ſaynt Hyrene a virgyn / that by ye erle Syſynny was ſlayne wt an arowe of his owne ſhotynge / by whoſe tyranny & falſe accuſacyons her two ſyſters ſaynt Agapes and ſaynt Chyon yt before ben ſpoken of were put to deth. At lice in ceſary ye feeſt of ſaynt Amphian & of ſaynt Marcian.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Vincent / a man of grete holynes / & of hygh doctryne / & of the ordre of ſaynt Dominyke. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Bene an abbot in deſert / yt (as ſaȳt Ierom wryteth) neuer ſware ne lyed / ne neuer was wroth / ne neuer ydle / & of mooſt ꝓfoūde mekenes / & dyd many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ma.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .vj. day of Apryl. at rome ye feeſt of ſaynt Syxt pope & martyr / yt in the tyme of the emperour Adriane gladly ſuffred deth for Chryſt. In macedony the feeſt of ſaynt Tymothy / and of ſaynt Diogenes.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Theodour byſſhop of ancyran a holy & grete lerned man / and made many werkes agaynſt hereſyes / ſpecially agaynſt ye heretyke Neſtor. At antioche ye feeſt of an other ſaȳt Theodour a preeſt yt alſo was a man of hygh doctryne & noble eloquence. & made .xv. bokes agaynſt ye heretykes called appolynaryes & anomeyes. The feeſt alſo of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .vij. daye of Apryll. In affryke ye feeſt of ſaynt Epiphan a biſſhop / ſaynt Donate / & other .xiij. ꝑſones all martyrs. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Ieſyppe / a grete holy man / yt was nere the tyme of ye apoſtles / & wrote all the actes of the prelates & faders of the chirche / from the paſſyon of Chryſt vnto his tyme / that lyke as he
folowed theyr holy lyfe & cōuerſacyon / ſo by his wrytynge other ꝑſones myght lerne the ſame. In alexander the feeſt of ſaynt Peluſe a preeſt of grete holynes.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In englonde ye feeſt of ſaynt Bernake a gentylman of grete poſſeſſyons / whiche all he ſolde & went on pylgrymage to rome / where & by the waye he dyd many myracles / & whan he came in to englonde agayne / he was of grete fame & moche magnifyed / whiche to declyne and auoyde / he fledde pryuely in to ſouth wales / where he was aſſayled wt the tētacyon & perſecucyon of a lady in lyke maner as Ioſeph in egypt / but with grace he vaynquyſſhed & was of hygh ꝑfeccyon / many myracles / & had reuelacyons & alſo vyſyons of aū gels. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .viij. daye of Apryll. At corynth ye feeſt of ſaynt Denyſe a byſſhop / by whoſe lernynge & gracyous ſermons in the tyme of Marke / Antony and Luke aurell emperours many perſones were gretly edifyed / & yet many ben edyfyed & inſtructed vnto this tyme. At turyne the feeſt of ſaynt Perpetuus / a man of meruaylous ſanctite.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Pitrion an abbot in the baide that was diſcyple vnto ſaynt Antony / a man of grete grace in helyng of ſeke ꝑſones / & in auoydyng of euyll ſpirytes / & had meruaylous knowlege of them where & in whome they dwelled / & he woldꝭ ofte ſaye yt a perſone ſholde neuer chace & auoyde wycked ſpirytes / tyll he fyrſt auoyded & chaced awaye his owne ſynnes / & that who ſo euer wolde vaynquyſſhe his owne vyces ſhold ſoone vaynquyſſhe all euyll ſpirytes / he was alſo
of precyſe abſtinence and many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .ix. day of Apryll. the feeſt of ſaynt Prokor / one of the .vij. fyrſt & chefe deacons / a famous man / that in antioche was put to martyrdom. In ſyryne ye feeſt of .vij. holy virgyns / that by theyr precyous & paynfull deth bought the herytage of blyſſe euerlaſtynge.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Dioſcour an abbot of .C. monkes / & a man of ſinguler ſanctite. In ye deſert of nitrea the feeſt of ſaȳt Ierony / yt was diſcyple vnto ſaȳt Antony / a man of mooſt ꝓfoūde mekenes / & there dyed in ye age of .C. & .x. yeres. The feeſt alſo of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .x. day of Apryll. the feeſt of ſaynt Ezechiel the ꝓphete / a martyr of ye olde teſtament / yt was ſlayne by a iudge of the chylder of iſraell in babylon / & was buryed in ye ſepulcre of Sem & Arphaxat. At rome ye feeſt of many martyrs yt were baptized of pope Alexander / & by the tyraūt Aurelian they were put in to the ſee in an olde ſhyppe / & theyr neckes teyed vnto grete ſtones and the ſhyppe bored / & ſo all drowned. At alexander ye feeſt of ſaynt Appolon a preeſt / & with hym other fyue perſones martyrs.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Diogenes an ancre / yt was diſcyple vnto ſaynt Antony in the deſert of nitrie / & by his holy worde moche edifyed many ꝑſones The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Iulius called by ſyrname Aphrycan / a grete wryter of ſtoryes / & reſtored many errours & contrauerſyes in the goſpell / ſpecyally in Mathewe and Luke. And the feeſt of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xj. daye of Apryll. the feeſt of ſaynt Leo ye pope in whoſe tyme was the ſene & generall coūſeyle of calcedonens. In crete at gortyn the feeſt of ſaynt Phylyp a byſſhop / yt in ye tyme of Antonyn vere & Lucy auriell emperours / was a man of grete fame / & honourable in all vertue & doctryne. In dalmatyke at ſaloma the feeſt of ſaȳt Domion a byſſhop / & of .viij. men of warre all martyrs. At nicomede the feeſt of ſaynt Euſtorge a preeſt. In brytayne the feeſt of ſaynt Guthlake a confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At turon the feeſt of ſaynt Agryke an abbot of grete holynes. At lyons the feeſt of ſaynt Fiagry a byſſhop. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Archiloke / called alſo Archilawe byſſhop of meſopotamy / a man of honourable cōuerſacyon / & of grete lernyng / yt made a boke agaynſt ye manyches / & diſputed ye ſame wt an heretyke / with many other noble actes. The feeſt alſo of many other ho.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xij. day of Apryll. At rome in aurely ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Iuly the pope / yt in the tyme of Cōſtance the emperour was exiled in grete trouble ye ſpace of .x. monethes / after whoſe deth he was brought agayne to rome wt grete glory & ioyfull triūphe / & there dyed in the peace of Chryſt. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt zenon / byſſhop of veronens / yt in the tyme of ſtrayte & cruell ꝑſecucyon ruled his chirche wt meruaylous wyſdom / & in the tyme of Galiene the emperour he ſuffred deth for ye ſame. At wapyng ye feeſt of ſaȳt Cōſtantyn a byſſhop.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ At alexander ye feeſt of ſaynt Agryppe called by ſyrname Caſtor / a cōfeſſour / & a man of ꝓfoūde doctryne /
that confoūded & improued .iiij.c. & .xxiiij. bokes / yt the heretyke Baſilides wrote vpon the goſpelles cōtrary vnto ye fayth & vnto the determynacyon of ye chirche / & he made a boke agaynſt them / & therin in a ſtyle mooſt eloquent he defended & declared the true fayth / and he was a notable man of holy lyfe & good example. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. confeſ.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xiij. day of Apryll. In aſya at pergamū the feeſt of ſaynt Carpe a byſſhop / & of ſaynt Papyre a deacon & of ye vertuous matrone ſaynt Agathonyke / & of many women that with her were put to deth by ye emperours Antonyne vere & Aurely comedy / wt the whiche women ſaynt Iuſtyne alſo was put to deth / a man of grete lernynge & eloquence / & toke grete labours for ye religyon of Chryſt. In ſpayne the feeſt of ſaynt Erminygyld a kyng / ye for Chryſtes fayth after many affliccyons was knocked on ye heed wt an axe / & ſo chaūged his tēporall realme for ye kyngdom of heuen. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Eufeme a virgyn & martyr called Effam.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In wales at breknoke the feeſt of ſaynt Caradoke / a man of noble blode / & fyrſt a courtyer & a galaūt / but after he forſoke ye worlde & was a preeſt of holy lyfe / & had reuelacyon of aūgels & open cōflict wt the deuyll / & dyd many grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Atyke byſſhop of cōſtantynople / a man of grete lernyng / that made a boke of fayth & of virgynite vnto ye doughters of ye emperour Archady / in ye whiche boke he alſo confoūded ye hereſyes of Neſtorye / & was of noble fame & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other ho.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xiiij. day of Apryl. At rome in appia ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Tiburce / ſaynt Valeriane & Maximy all martyrs. At alexander ye feeſt of ſaynt Fronton an abbot of grete fame & holynes. At interamnis the feeſt of ſaynt Procule a martyr. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Dōnyne a virgyn / & wt her many other virgyns all martyrs

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Bacchyle byſſhop of corynthy a man of ſynguler ſanctite & grete lernynge. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Fetyke byſſhop of aduens / a man alſo of notable lernynge / & made a boke agaynſt the heretyke Nouaciane / wt many other profytable werkes / & was of hygh ꝑfeccion & holynes. The feeſt alſo of many.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xv. day of Apryl. In perſe at corduba the feeſt of ſaynt Olympiade / and of ſaynt Maximy martyrs / that were noble men of byrth / and for Chryſtes fayth they ſuffred by Decius ye emperour many turmentes & at the laſt they were knocked on ye hedes wt butchers axes lyke beeſtes / & ſo accōplyſſhed theyr martyrdom. In ytaly the feeſt of ſaynt Maro / ſaynt Euticete / and ſaynt Victoryne martyrs / yt were fyrſt exiled in to the yle of ponciane / where they cōuerted many ꝑſones / & after by prynce Nerue they were by many varyaunt turmentes put to deth.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Paterne / borne of ye noble blode of englond / & of youth applyed all to vertue / yt with ſaynt Dauid went vnto Ieruſalē / where he receyued ſodeynly ye grace of tōgues to ſpeke in euery lāguage / where alſo he dyd many myracles / & was there made byſſhop by ye handes of ye patriarke / & after came in to englond where he had the reuelacyon of aūgels / & reyſed
two perſones to lyf / wt many other grete myracles. In englond alſo at norwyche ye feeſt of ſaynt wylliam of whome his moder had reuelacion whan he was in her wombe / he was of poore byrth / & a childe ſet vnto a crafte in norwyche / where certayn iewes that tyme dwellyng ſtale hym vpon a good fryday / & with meruaylous turmentes they crucyfyed hym in the age of xij. yeres / & after by reuelacyon he was founde / & dyd many myracles / & ſo he dyd in his lyfe before he was vij. yeres olde. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xvj. day of Apryll. At corynthe ye feeſt of ſaynt Calixt & of ſaynt Cariſy / wt other .vij. ꝑſones all drowned in the ſee. In ceſarauguſt ye feeſt of .xviij. martyrs that is to ſaye / ſaynt Quintilian / ſaynt Caſſian / ſaynt Matutyn / ſaynt Publy / ſaynt Vrbane / ſaynt Marciall / ſaynt Fauſter / ſaynt Succeſſe / ſaynt Felix / ſaynt Ianuary / ſaynt Primityue / ſaynt Euote / ſaynt Cecilian / ſaynt Optate / ſaynt frōton / ſaynt Lupert / ſaynt Apodeme / & ſaynt Iuly / that by ye preſident of ſpayne Daciane were put to deth by mooſt greuous turmentes for ye gloryous name of Chryſt.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ In egypte ye feeſt of ſaynt Pholcas byſſhop of tampnis a noble man borne & of grete poſſeſſions & ryches & all he lefte to ſerue god / & was of grete lernyng & very eloquent / & he made a boke of ye laude of holy martyrs / wherin he prophecyed of his owne martyrdom. & ſo was he put to deth in the ꝑſecucyon of Maximian the emperour. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Gēnand byſſhop of cōſtantinople / a man of quycke vnderſtandyng / & of eloquence / & he expowned the boke of Daniel thrugh / with many other werkes / & was alſo of ſynguler ſanctite.
The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xvij. day of Apryll. In affryke ye feeſt of ſaynt Mappalyke a martyr / yt (as ſaynt Ciprian wryteth) was put to deth wt many other ꝑſones. At antioche ye feeſt of ſaynt Peter a deacon / & of ſaynt Hermogeny. In the eeſt countree ye feeſt of ſaynt Nicofore / yt vnder Valerian & Galiene ye emperours was put to deth for Chryſt. At corduba the feeſt of ſaynt Hely a preeſt / & of ſaynt Paule & ſaynt Iſidour monkes. At rome ye feeſt of ſaynt Anicete pope & martyr.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Heleny an abbot / yt in deſert dyd many myracles / & in diſputyng longe tyme wt an heretyke he entred a grete fyre in ye quarel of his fayth and remayned therin a longe ſeaſon wtout hurte or blemyſſhe / wherby the heretyke was confoūded / he had alſo reuelacyon of aūgelles. The feeſt alſo of an other ſaynt Paule an abbot in libia / & fader of .v.C. monkes & of hygh ꝑfeccyon. The feeſt alſo of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xviij. day of Apryll. In naples at meſſany the feeſt of ſaynt Eulether a byſſhop / and of ſaynt Anthye his moder / a man he was of hygh ꝑfeccyon & a martyr / yt by prynce Adriane was put to many cruell turmentes / he was caſt vpon a bedde of yren full of pryckes / & than lyke ſaynt Laurēce layd vpon a hote gyrdyron / after that he was put in to a potte boylynge wt oyle / pytche / roſyne & brymſtone / & yet after caſt vnto wylde wode beeſtes / & euer he remayned vnhurt / & at the laſt he was heded wt his ſayd moder. At rome the feeſt of ſaynt Appolon a ſenatour / yt by his owne ſeruaūt was accuſed vnto prynce Comodꝰ for a chriſtyan
and brought before the ſenate / where he redde openly a boke yt he had made of the prayſe & poyntes of Chryſtes fayth & religyon / for the whiche by ye iudgement of the ſame ſenate he was heded. At corduba ye feeſt of ſaynt Perfyte a preeſt & martyr. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Lafreane an abbot.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Apollon an abbot of .v.C. monkes / yt for more ꝑfeccyon dwelled in a caue or den / nere vnto hermepole / where our ſauyour Chryſt appered vnto hym & badde hym put his hande in his owne boſom / & pull out what he foūde & holde faſt / & he pulled out a fende a deuyll: yt fende ſayd Chryſt is ye ſpiryte of pryde / wherwith yu haſt ben ſore aſſayled / & for ye auoydaūce wherof yu haſt ſo longe & cōtinually prayed / thou haſt now vaynquyſſhed hym / do wt hym what yu wylt for yu art now delyuered of hym / & than the holy fader caſt hym in a quykſand / & lowly thanked our lord / and ſo he returned to his monaſtery / where he fedde a hole coūtree .iiij. monethes wc the vytayle yt was ſcant able & ſufficyent for his breder by theyr cuſtome one day / & many other grete myracles he dyd. The feeſt alſo of ye thyrde ſaȳt Appolon a cōfeſſour / a holy man & of grete charite to ſeke ꝑſones. The feeſt alſo of many oth.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xix. daye of Apryll. the feeſt of ſaynt Thimon / one of the .vij. fyrſt deacons / yt was a doctour of Chryſtes fayth at beron / & goynge about to preche ye worde of god / he came to corynth / where by malyce of the iewes & of the grekes he was caſt in to a grete fyre / but no hurte had / than was he nayled vnto the croſſe lyke vnto his mayſter Chryſt / & ſo ended his martyrdome. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Alphege an archebyſſhop & martyr.
At mylytane in armeny the feeſt of ſaynt Hermogenis / ſaynt Gayus / ſaynt Expedite / ſaȳt Ariſtonyke ſaynt Rufe / & ſaynt Galathe al martyrs. At cantiliber the paſſyon of ſaynt Vincent a martyr. In ye ſuburbes of hamonens ye feeſt of ſaȳt Coſmare a byſſhop & cōfeſſour of ſynguler vertue & holynes.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Fronton an abbot / & fader of lx. monkes yt lyued in deſert / & neuer made ꝓuyſyon of ony fode for the next daye / but euer abode ye ordynaūce of god / & yet they neuer wanted / for an aūgell warned the ryche men of the cytees by courſe to viſyte them wt fode. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Leo the .x. pope of yt name a man of ſynguler pyte vnto the poore. And the feeſt of ſaynt Tymon byſſhop of veſegoryne in araby / where he for Chryſt was put to martyrdome. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. and virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xx. daye of Apryll. at rome ye feeſt of ſaynt Victor the .xv. pope after ſaȳt Peter / & .x. yeres he moche edifyed ye chirche of Chryſt / & than by prynce Seuere put to deth. At rome alſo ye feeſt of ſaynt Sulpice / ſaȳt Publy & ſaynt Seruulane martyrs / yt were cōuerted by the prechynge & myracles of ſaynt Domicill ye virgyn / & after bycauſe they wold not do ſacrefyce vnto ye ydolles / they were by the mayre Aniane all heded. In fraūce at bredunens the feeſt of ſaynt Marcell a cōfeſſour / & biſſhop of the ſame cite / yt by diuyne reuelacyon came from affrike vnto the moūtaynes of ytaly wt his diſciples & companyons ſaynt Vincent & ſaynt Domnion / where by his holy worde & myracles he cōuerted the mooſt parte of yt coūtree.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of an other ſaynt Victor biſſhop of cartage
a holy man & of ꝓfoūde doctryne / yt wrote a boke agaynſt ye hereſyes & opinyons of ye grete heretyke Arrius / wt many other good werkes vnto ye edificacyon of Chryſtes fayth. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxj. day of Apryl. In perſe ye feeſt of ſaynt Symeon a byſſhop & martyr / yt by kyng Sapour of perſe was taken / & confeſſynge wt lowde voyce the name of Chryſt he was put in harde priſon / & wt hym .C. other ꝑſones / ſome preeſtes / & other of dyuerſe orders / & at ye laſt after many turmentes he & they al were heded / wt whome alſo were put to deth certayne noble perſones ſaynt Vſkazand / ſaynt Abdell / ſaynt Ananye / & ſaynt Publy wt his doughter a holy ſacred virgin. At alexander ye feeſt of ſaynt Arator a preeſt / ſaynt Fortune / ſaȳt Felix / ſaynt Syluy & ſaynt Vitale all martyrs / & dyed in priſon. The depoſicyon alſo of ſaynt Ancelme an archebyſſhop of Caūterbury.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Gulph yle the fyrſt byſſhop & apoſtle of the people called gothes / yt by his holy lyfe / grete myracles & dilygent prechynge / ¶ Note here how dilygent holy faders were to trāſlate holy ſcripture ī to the moder tōgue and cōmune language. conuerted them vnto Chryſt / and he fyrſt ordeyned lettres & the wrytynge of theyr ſpeche / for before they had no wrytyng but all by hert / and he tranſlated the byble in to theyr moder tongue and commune language. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Gemyne byſſhop of niſebene / a man of grete lernynge for his age / & of ſynguler ſanctite. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxij. day of Apryll. At rome in appia ſtrete the feeſt of ſaynt Gay pope / yt after he had ben pope .xj. yeres .vij. monethes and .xij. dayes / was put to martyrdom
by the prynce Dioclecian. In perſe ye feeſt of many martyrs vnnamed / yt were put to deth by ye tyraūt kynge Sapour / amonge whome theſe were knowen ſaynt Meleſy a byſſhop / ſaynt Accepſymy a byſſhop with his preeſt ſaynt Iames / ſaynt Marcias & ſaynt Bitro bothe byſſhops wt .CC. ꝑſones of theyr clergy / & with .l. monkes / and many ſacred virgyns / amonge whome ſaynt Tarbua a quene & ſyſter vnto ye byſſhop ſaynt Symeon / wt her bondmayd / were kytte thrugh the bodyes wt a ſawe. At corduba ye feeſt of ſaynt Permenye / ſaynt Helymen & ſaynt Schryſotele preeſtes / & of ſaynt Luke & ſaynt Mycy deacons / al martyrs / of whoſe triūphe & noble victory is wryten in ye legend & paſſyon of ſaynt Laurence. At lyons the feeſt of ſaynt Epypode a martyr / yt by the perſecucyon of Antonyne vere / was after many turmentes heded. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Sother pope & martyr. And ye inuencyon of ſaynt Denyſe & his felowes.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Oportune a virgyn / & an abbeſſe / of many grete graces / ſpecially in curyng of ſeke ꝑſones. At rome ye feeſt of an other ſaȳt Gay a preeſt & cōfeſſour / a man of grete holynes & of excellēt doctryne that confoūded & deſtroyed many hereſyes. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Leo ye fyrſt pope of yt name / yt cōdempned many heretikes / & wrote agaynſt them many werkes by ye reuelacyon & inſtruccyon of ſaynt Peter / & where he had ſtryken of his owne hand / bycauſe it was occaſyon of tēptacyon vnto a frayle woman / it was agayn reſtored by the myracle of our bleſſed lady / & he after of more hygh ꝑfeccyō & many myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Agapite ye fyrſt pope of yt name / yt fyrſt ordered ye euery ſonday ſholde be ꝓceſſyon / & he was of grete holynes
& many myracles. The feeſt alſo of many.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxiij. daye of Apryll. In perſe at dyoſpole the paſſyon of ſaȳt George a martyr / whoſe geſtes (as vnto grete parte) ben nōbred amonge ye apocriphaſe / Apocripha ben called ſuche ſtoryes or writynges as ben of no ſure grounde ne of certayn auctoryte / & therfore ben not accepted for verey trouth / all though they may ſōtyme be wryten / ſpoken & byleued without offence. notwithſtandynge his noble martyrdom is had in ye chirche in ſolempne honour & deuout reuerence / ſpecyally in englonde. In fraūce at valence ye feeſt of ſaynt Felix a preeſt / & of ſaȳt Fortunate & ſaynt Achilley deacons / that whan they had cōuerted the mooſt parte of yt cite vnto Chryſt / were taken / impryſoned / ſcourged / theyr legges & thyes broken / & all theyr membres & hole body ſtretched vpon a rote or turnyng whele / hanged on a gybet ouer a grete ſmoke / and at the laſt ended theyr martyrdom by the ſwerde. In the caſtell of ſyluanect the feeſt of ſaynt Rule / a byſſhop & cōfeſſour. At bruce the feeſt of ſaynt Adhelbert a biſſhop & martyr of hygh perfeccyon.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Leomy a byſſhop / & of ſaynt Malachy ye prophete. In egypte ye feeſt of ſaynt Heraclide a cōfeſſour / yt was diſciple vnto ſaynt Iſidour / & by hym brought vnto the deſert of the baydes / & there cōmitted diſciple vnto ſaynt Dorothey ye holy abbot wt whom he lyued many yeres / & after hym he occupyed his rome & place / & wente aboute vnto many ſolytary perſones / & wrote a boke of theyr lyues / & ſo after many myracles and grete holynes he departed vnto our lorde. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p:
¶ The .xxiiij. day of Apryll. In fraūce at lyons ye feeſt of ſaynt Alexander a martyr / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of Antonyne vere was ſo rent & torne in his body wt hokes yt
his rybbes opened & his bowelles came out / & after all he was (as his mayſter) put vpon the croſſe where he yelded his holy ſpiryte / & wt hym were put to deth alſo xxxiiij. other ꝑſones. In brytayn ye feeſt of ſaynt Mellyte a byſſhop & cōfeſſour. At hylyber the feeſt of ſaynt Gregory a byſſhop & confeſſour. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Crowne a virgyn.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt of ſaynt Egbert yt was borne in englonde & ſpent his lyf hooly in other londes in prechyng & pylgrymage. And ye feeſt of ſaynt wylfryde archebyſſhop of yorke / borne in englonde of ye blode royall. At whoſe byrth was ſeen a pyller of fyre / ſo yt all the hous ſemed on fyre / he was euer vertuous from youth / & ſo contynued in ſinguler perfeccion & many myracles. The inuencion alſo of ſaynt Yue. At bleſe ye feeſt of ſaynt Deo date an abbot. At reme the feeſt of ſaynt Boue / & ſaynt Dode bothe virgyns. And ye feeſt alſo of many oth.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxv. day of Apryll. At rome is the grete letany & ꝓceſſyon vnto ye chirche of ſaynt Peter. At alexander the feeſt of ſaynt Marke ye euangelyſt / yt was diſcyple vnto ſaynt Peter / and his interpretour / yt required inſtaūtly by many peticyons of ye chryſtyans / wrote the goſpell & lyfe of Ieſu / & whan they had receyued & admytted ye ſame goſpell / he went in to egypt / & he fyrſt preched Chryſtes ſayth in alexander / & there he ordeyned a chirche / & than was he taken by the infydeles & put to many cruell turmentes / in ye whiche he had cō fort by ye reuelacyons of aūgels / & after of our ſauyour hymſelfe / by whome he was called vnto ye kyngdome celeſtyall the .viij. yere of Nero the emperour. At ſyracuſane the feeſt of ſaynt Euody & ſaynt Hermogenis.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Adelbert a byſſhop & a martyr / that was a noble man borne and all applyed vnto vertu / & brought vp in lernynge wt the archebiſſhop of paryhenopole / after whoſe deth he was called vnto ye emperours courte & made a knyght / but after by diuyne reuelacyon he was called agayn to religyon & was byſſhop of prage / a holy man & diligent in prechynge / ſpecially vnto ye infydeles / of whome by ye laſt he was put to martyrdom. The feeſt alſo of many other.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxvj. daye of Apryll. At rome the feeſt of ſaynt Clete ye ſeconde pope after ſaynt Peter / yt after he had ruled & gouerned the chirche .xij. yeres / was in ye perſecucyon of ye emperour Domician put to martyrdom. At rome alſo the feeſt of ſaynt Marcellyne a byſſhop / that whan he had wel gouerned his chirche .ix. yeres & .iiij. monethes / was in the ꝑſecucyon of ye emperour Dioclecian put to deth / & wt hym ſaynt Claudy / ſaynt Ciryne & ſaynt Antonyn. In yt tyme was a grete ꝑſecucyon / ſo yt in one moneth .xvij.M. chryſtyans were put vnto martyrdome. In the fraūcheſt of pontyne at the monaſtery of Centule the feeſt of ſaynt Rychary a preeſt & confeſſour.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ In the yle of ſardyny ye feeſt of ſaynt Lucifere byſſhop of calaritane / yt wrote a boke agaynſt ye hereſy of Arrius / & ſent the ſame boke vnto the emperour Conſtance yt was of the ſame opinyon / by whome he was put in exile / after whoſe deth he moche edyfyed ye chirche of Chryſt / of whome ſaynt Ierome wryteth. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mar. cōf. & virg.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxvij. day of Apryl. At rome the depoſicyon of ſaynt Anaſtace the pope / of whome ſaynt Ierom reuerently ſayth / the worlde was not worthy to haue his lyf ony longe tyme. At nicomede the feeſt of ſaynt Anchymy a byſſhop & martyr / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of Dioclecian (as is wryten in the ſtory eccleſiaſtyke) was heded / & with hym ye mooſt parte of all his flocke & cure was put to deth / ſome heded / ſome maymed / ſome brent / ſome manacled & caſt in to the ſee / & ſome ſlayne by many other cruell turmentes. In ſicilie at tharſe ye feeſt of ſaynt Caſtor & of ſaynt Stephan martyrs.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p: ¶ At altyne the feeſt of ſaynt Liberall a confeſſour of hygh perfeccyon / & had reuelacyon of aūgels. At ciuilitane ye feeſt of ſaynt Pule a lector in ordre / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of Dioclecian & Maximian the emperours ſuffred paſſyon for Chryſt: The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Ancare a man of meruaylous ſanctite. And the feeſt of many other holy ſayntes / martyrs / confeſſours & virgyns.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxviij. day of Apryll. At rauen ye feeſt of ſaynt Vitale a martyr / yt bycauſe he buryed wt due reuerence the holy body of ſaynt Vrſylyne / was taken by the tribune Paulyn / & after rackynge & many turmentes he was buryed quycke. At alexander ye feeſt of ſaȳt Theodour a virgyn / yt bycauſe ſhe wold not do ſacrefyce vnto the ydolles / was ſent to ye bordelhous / from whens ſaynt Didymus inflambed wt heuenly zele / rauyſſhed her by violence & ſtrength / and after wt her was put to martyrdome. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Affrodoſe / ſaynt Carilyppe / ſaynt Agapy / & ſaynt Euſeby all martyrs At padway the feeſt of ſaynt Palion a martyr.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Valeriane / wyfe vnto ſaynt Vitale / that after ſhe had ſought her ſayd houſbonde was in her returne taken by ye infydeles & put to deth. At treuer the feeſt of ſaynt Latrocinian a martyr / that borne in ſpayne came in to fraūce / & there ſowed ye ſede of Chryſt / & was there put therfore to deth by ye tyraūt Maximian / & in ye tyme of ye emperour Theodoſius / ye fyrſt of yt name. The feeſt alſo of many other holy.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxix. day of Apryl. At paphū the feeſt of ſaynt Tite diſciple vnto ſaynt Paule / whome oft he remembreth in his epyſtles / callyng hym his mooſt dere broder & felowe in ye ſeruice & bondage of god. In numyde at a vyllage nere vnto circen ye feeſt of ſaynt Agapite & ſaynt Secūdyne byſſhops & martyrs / yt in the ꝑſecucyon of the emperour Valerian / were after many turmentes put to dethe / & wt them alſo ſuffred deth ſaynt Emilian a man of warre / ſaynt Tercull & ſaynt Antony virgyns / & a woman vnnamed wt her two chylder twyndles. At myllen ye feeſt of ſaynt Peter a martyr / one of the ordre of freres prechers. In Brytayne the tranſlacyon of ſaynt Edmonde kynge and martyr.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaynt wylfryde the yonger / yt was alſo archebyſſhop of yorke. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Torpede a martyr / & of ſaynt Leo a biſſhop in grece / of ſynguler holy lyfe / & of grete myracles / & in his deth many moo. The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt Robert / yt was fyrſt foū der of ye order of cirſterciens / called the whyte monkes he was before abbot of ye monaſtery of molyſme / & bycauſe he wold lyue a more harde lyf / he toke .xxj. of his
mooſt holy monkes / & went vnto a wyldernes called ciſterciū / where by the auctorite of ye archebyſſhop of lyons / & of the byſſhop of cabilony / & by ye helpe of the duke of burgoyn called Odo / he buylded a monaſtery & there began the ſayd ordre of whyte monkes / & after he refourned his owne monaſtery vnto the ſame ꝑfeccion & many other monaſteryes / & was of many grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of ſaynt Marian a lay broder & a monke of biturience yt was a herdman & kepte the beeſtes of ye monaſtery / & he ſaued a wylde bore from hunters that chaſed hym / & euer after he folowed the holy man all his lyfe as a tame dogge. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart. confeſ. & virgyns.

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: ¶ The .xxx. daye of Apryll. At lambeſitane the feeſt of ſaynt Mariane a lectour in ordre / and ſaynt Iames a deacon / that were put in pryſon & there cōforted by diuyne reuelacyon / & than after many cruell turmentes they were ſlayne by the ſwerde / & wt them many other chryſtyans. At ſanctonas the feeſt of ſaynt Eutrope a martyr / whome ſaynt Clement the pope made a byſſhop / & than ſent hym in to fraūce / where he cōuerted moche people / & dyd many myracles / and after for the fayth of Chryſt he was heded. In englonde at london the depoſicyon of ſaynt Erkenwald byſſhop of ye ſame cite / a cōfeſſour of grete holynes / in lyf & myracles moche famous & honourable.

div.head: ¶ Addicyons.
div.p:
¶ The feeſt alſo of ſaȳt zozimas an abbot in ye partyes of paleſtyne nere vnto egipte / a man of hygh ꝑfeccyon and a grete labourer in ſekyng of ſtraūge places & vnuſed deſertes / in whiche ſerche and labours he founde ſaynt Mary egypciake / & buryed her as on her day is
ſhewed / & after he returned vnto his monaſtery / where he remayned in mooſt holy lyfe and grete myracles. The feeſt alſo of many other holy ſayntes / mart.
etc

div.head: ¶ To morowe.
div.p: May. THe fyrſt daye of May. In egypt the feeſt of the prophete Ieremy a martyr of ye olde teſtament that of the people was murthered wt ſtones caſt vpon hȳ in a grete hepe / & ſo dyed at a place called taphnas. The feeſt alſo of ye holy apoſtles ſaynt Phylip & ſaynt Iames / whiche ſaynt Phylip after he had conuerted nere all the londe of ſythe / was put to dethe in aſia at ierapole / & ſaȳt Iames called ye broder of our ſauyour Ieſu / was caſt downe heedlonge from an hygh place nere vnto the temple in Ieruſalem / & ſo his necke broken / & he there buryed. In fraūce in ye fraūcheſt of viuariens ye feeſt of ſaynt Andeole a ſubdeacon / whome ſaynt Policarpe ſent from the eeſt partyes in to fraūce with dyuerſe other felowes to preche ye fayth / whiche whan ye emperour Seuery had perceyued / he cauſed hym to be takē & cruelly to be beten wt thorny buſſhes & breres / & ſo put hym in harde priſon / & at the laſt after moche afflyccyon he was ſawed ouerthwarte ye heed in croſſe wyſe wt a ſawe of harde wode / & ſo ended his martyrdom. At ſedunens ye feeſt of ſaynt Sygiſmund the kyng. At auſtrace ye feeſt of ſaynt Orient a byſſhop & cōfeſſour of holy lyfe & ſynguler vertues / & therafter made a gloryous ende.
